TopicTitle: I realized I played too much KSP when I seen this...

Articles.Content: After a very rough night last night I woke up this morning and thought that these trees were more aerodynamic.
lol... they just need moar boosters! (and some fire retardant)

that... is not terribly surprising. I thought they looked like nose cones when I saw the picture too.

Perhaps it's just a sign that KSP nosecones look like snowcones.
This reminds me of the time I saw a man in a green hoodie out of the corner of my eye and thought he was a creeper...
It took me a while to realize they were trees, you're doing better than I am.

This kind of thing happens to me all the time.

"Why are there nosecones from KSP on the ceiling? Oh, wait, they're lights. I should use that idea on my space station..."

It took me a while to realize they were trees, you're doing better than I am.

Well not so much being better, but rather I see those trees everyday while sitting in front of my computer . Last year it was actually worse you couldn't even see those trees due to the snow. The tip of the one to the left is eye level to me and I am 6'4" but the tree is only a touch over 4 foot, oh and more snow is yet to come.

Want to know my biggest pet peeve? When people say outer space. Outer space?! Where's inner space, then? Huh?! HUH?!

Seriously, it drives me insane every time I hear someone say that. KSP'll do that to ya.

What?

Want to know my biggest pet peeve? When people say outer space. Outer space?! Where's inner space, then? Huh?! HUH?!

Seriously, it drives me insane every time I hear someone say that. KSP'll do that to ya.

What?

Well there is this for inner space

Want to know my biggest pet peeve? When people say outer space. Outer space?! Where's inner space, then? Huh?! HUH?!
Space is the boundless three-dimensional extent in which objects and events have relative position and direction.
Ergo, "outer space" is needed, unless it's obvious from the context, to distinguish it from plain old space.

I remember once at school I saw my art teacher drawing a green planet, and I said, "Where's Laythe?"

Also, I once looked up at the moon and thought "Let's see if I can spot a colony" and then I was like..... Oh yeah, we don't have colonies yet...
